assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: FALCON v. DX 2.0.2; FALCON-Unzip v. DX 8.0.1; purge_dups v. DX 19-08-10; scaff10X v. DX 2.0.3; bionano Solve v. DX 3.4.0; Salsa2 HiC v. DX 2.2.0; pbalign v. 0.3.2; pbgcpp v. 1.9.0; Longranger Align v. DX 2.2.2.1; freebayes v. DX 19-07-11; gEVAL manual curation v. 2021-03-24; VGP assembly pipeline v. 1.5

bioprojects.title: Chelmon rostratus (copperband butterflyfish) genome, fCheRos1, alternate haplotype

attributes.name: biomaterial_provider
attributes.value: Institute of Molecular and Cell Biology

biosample.biomaterialProvider: Institute of Molecular and Cell Biology

description.comment: The Copperband butterflyfish (Chelmon rostratus) is found Pacific and Indian Oceans reefs. They have long beaks, very colorful like butterflies, and are used in aquariums.  This sample was collected by Byrappa Venkatesh, supported by Gene Myers, in collaboration with Richard Durbin, and used to generate a high-quality reference genome as part of the G10K-VGP and Fish VGP projects.
description.title: Animal sample from Chelmon rostratus

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: Butterflyfish sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel II CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
